author: Harper Lee
review: A gripping, heart-wrenching, and wholly remarkable tale of coming-of-age in a South poisoned by virulent prejudice.

author: George Orwell
review: A dystopian social science fiction novel and cautionary tale about the dangers of totalitarianism.

author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
review: A novel of the Jazz Age that tells the story of the mysterious Jay Gatsby and his unrequited love for Daisy Buchanan.

author: Jane Austen
review: A romantic novel that charts the emotional development of the protagonist, Elizabeth Bennet.

author: J.R.R. Tolkien
review: A fantasy novel that follows the quest of home-loving hobbit Bilbo Baggins to win a share of the treasure guarded by the dragon Smaug.

author: J.D. Salinger
review: A novel about a young man's disillusionment with the adult world and his quest for meaning.

author: Paulo Coelho
review: A novel that tells the story of a young Andalusian shepherd's journey to Egypt, after having a recurring dream of finding treasure there.

author: J.R.R. Tolkien
review: An epic high-fantasy novel that follows the quest to destroy the One Ring and ensure the destruction of its maker, Sauron.

author: J.K. Rowling
review: A young boy discovers he's a wizard on his eleventh birthday and attends Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.
